message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.HC, cs.CL

This paper deals with building a recommendation system for lifelong learning, which involves leveraging sensible learning trajectories for the learner. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the sub-categories of machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Additionally, the paper deals with modeling content novelty and background knowledge of learners, which suggests that it may also belong to the sub-category of information retrieval (cs.IR). The paper also emphasizes the need for transparent and accurate learner representations, which suggests that it may belong to the sub-categories of human-computer interaction (cs.HC) and computational linguistics (cs.CL).
